intro: Pedicularis rainierensis, commonly known as the Rainier beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its hemiparasitic relationship with host plants. The plant produces striking pink to purple tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and meadows. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a notable species in botanical studies.
